sections.title: Our mission
sections.subtitle:
Through data made easily accessible, we empower retailers to focus on
what really matters: Operating efficient stores where meaningful engagement happens.

featured.text:
Shoppers are demanding more meaningful in-store experiences than ever.
We believe retailers can only keep up with those expectations when they’re equipped
with accurate data about how their stores perform. So we’re focused on one thing:
Making it easier for every retailer to be operationally excellent, unlocking
more possibilities for teams of all sizes to understand the health of their
stores.

It’s impossible to consistently deliver a great store experience without
accurate foot traffic data. Retail ops and marketing leaders lose money in guessing
games. We are here to help you get out of that game with a people counting sensor
that’s truly accurate — capturing the highest quality data in the widest possible
variety of environments and doorways consistently, so your data can appreciate
over time.

sections.title: Full visibility
sections.subtitle:
Retailers are only as successful as the data they collect, own and enrich
over time. The only actionable data set is accurate people counts for every revenue-generating
doorway in your business.

featured.text:
It’s impossible to make any decisions for your retail business without a
people counting solution delivering full visibility of every store through accurate
counts of the traffic relevant to your goals. Full visibility means having a
people counting solution in every single revenue-generating doorway in your
business. It’s knowing not just a sample size of your performance, but the whole
picture.

Accurate foot traffic counts are only possible with full visibility, using
technology that achieves the closest to 100% accurate counts with enough consistency
to establish trends over time. In the industry of people counting, 70-85% is
considered standard, and that’s using outdated technologies like cameras that
deploy too slowly to make full coverage and therefore true accuracy possible
in the first place.
